title: The Complete Soroban Learning Path – From Zero to Mental Math
description: How long does it take to learn Soroban? Where should kids start? Here's the complete roadmap I followed with my child from beginner to mental calculation.
imageAlt: Child progressing through Soroban levels from beginner to advanced

content.intro: Parents often ask: How long does Soroban take? Where should we start? Here's the complete roadmap I followed with my son – from complete beginner to doing mental math.

rows: More play than study. Fine motor skills still developing.
Can focus 15-20 minutes. Learning numbers at school.
Understands concepts faster. Can advance quickly.
Still works but needs more time to build reflexes.

sections.text: The "golden age" is 6-8 years old. But it's never too late. Even adults can learn Soroban.

items: Abacus structure: the bar, heaven beads, earth beads
Representing numbers 0-9 on a single column

sections.text: **Goal:** Child is comfortable with the abacus and can represent any number.
**Goal:** Child can do simple calculations fluently on the abacus.
Stage 3: Friends of 5 & Friends of 10 (2-3 months)

items: Friends of 5: When you need more than 4 earth beads
Friends of 10: Carrying to the next column
These are the "secrets" that unlock faster calculation

sections.text: **Goal:** Child understands and applies complement rules naturally.
**Goal:** Child handles complex calculations with speed and accuracy.
**Goal:** Child calculates mentally without physical abacus – this is the ultimate skill.
Most kids reach basic mental math ability in 6-12 months. But like any skill, the more you practice, the faster you get.
How Long Does Each Stage Take?

items: **12 months:** Confident mental calculation with 2-3 digit numbers
**2+ years:** Advanced speed and competitions level

sections.text: Every child is different. Some progress faster, some need more time. What matters is consistent practice, not racing through levels.

faq.question: Can my child skip stages if they're older?
faq.answer: Older kids often move through Stage 1-2 faster because they already know numbers. But Stages 3-4 (complement rules) still take the same time since it's new for everyone.

faq.question: What if my child gets stuck at a stage?
faq.answer: Totally normal. Spend more time on practice before moving on. Rushing leads to weak foundations. The Sorokid app automatically adjusts pace based on performance.

faq.question: How do I know my child is ready for mental Soroban?
faq.answer: When they can do abacus calculations without looking at their fingers – just hearing the beads move. Usually after 4-6 months of consistent practice.
